definition: Iron-Crutch Li, one of the Eight Immortals 八仙[Ba1 xian1] in Chinese mythology, walking around with an iron crutch and carrying a gourd with special medicine
plum
surname Li
iron (metal)/arms/weapons/hard/strong/violent/unshakeable/determined/close/tight (slang)
surname Tie
to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])
see 李鐵拐|李铁拐[Li3 Tie3 guai3]
the Eight Immortals (Daoist mythology)
Lü Dongbin (796-), Tang Dynasty scholar, one of the Eight Immortals 八仙[Ba1 xian1]
see 呂洞賓|吕洞宾[Lu:3 Dong4 bin1]
Daoist priest
Huang Shigong, also known as Xia Huanggong 夏黃公|夏黄公[Xia4 Huang2 gong1] (dates of birth and death uncertain), Daoist hermit of the Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin2 dai4] and purported author
Chen Tuan (871-989), a legendary Daoist sage
Zhao Gongming, God of Wealth in the Chinese folk tradition and Taoism
Daoist immortal/supernatural entity/(in modern fiction) fairy, elf, leprechaun etc/fig. lighthearted person
Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism/Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)
to die/to fly on a crane
Lü Yan (lived c. 874), Tang dynasty poet
Ge Hong (283-363), Jin dynasty Daoist and alchemist, author of 抱樸子|抱朴子[Bao4 pu3 zi3]
Marshal Zhao, aka Zhao Gongming or Zhao Xuantan, God of Wealth in the Chinese folk tradition and Taoism
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
Dipamkara Buddha, the former Buddha before Shakyamuni Buddha and the bringer of lights
